node.title: Sunbaking croc forces closure of Port Douglas beach
node.alt: A juvenile crocodile lying on the tide-line at a tropical beach.
node.description: A popular beach favoured by US presidents and celebrities has been closed after a crocodile was spotted sunning itself on the beach.
node.content:
["A sunbaking crocodile has forced the closure of a popular beach in Far North Queensland.", "Four Mile Beach at Port Douglas has long been favoured by US presidents and celebrities, but today an unexpected guest also decided to drop by.", "Surf Life Saving Queensland head lifeguard for the region Jay March said the 1.5 metre crocodile was spotted near a stinger enclosure early this morning.", "\"Our lifeguard was setting up his beach and nearly stood on the little critter actually \u2014 he was sitting there just next to the net,\" Mr March said.", "\"A lot of young crocs like that get a bit tired when the weather is a bit rough, they're out cruising and sometimes need a bit of a break and the net seems to give them a bit of shelter.\"", "", "
Four Mile Beach at Port Douglas was closed after the croc was spotted near a stinger enclosure.(Jane Bunce: AAP\u00a0\u2014 file photo)
", "
Out and about
", "Mr March said the crocodile moved on, but\u00a0the beach was closed for several hours.", "He said Queensland Parks and Wildlife rangers had been alerted and signs\u00a0warning of the sighting would be placed in the area.", "Mr March said it was not unusual to see the occasional croc in the area.", "\"We usually start seeing them around the end of September, they pop up when they're looking around for a new partner or a new place to live for the summer,\"\u00a0 he said.", "\"Once it warms up they get a bit more active \u2014 it's not unusual.", "\"They usually keep to themselves, but every now and again they'll cruise past and have a look around.\"", "", "
Temporary signs\u00a0similar to this one will be placed in the area.(ABC Capricornia: Tobias Jurss-Lewis)
", "The last fatal crocodile attack in the Port Douglas area was in 2017.", "Anne Cameron, 79,\u00a0disappeared from aged care facility Ozcare near Port Douglas\u00a0after she went for a walk.", "Her remains were later found in a 4.3 metre crocodile."]
